Wisdom: الْكِتْمَانُ مِلَاكُ النَّجْوَى
enWisdom: Secrecy is the basis of confidential conversations

Wisdom: الْمَرْءُ أَحْفَظُ لِسِرِّهِ
enWisdom: Man is more protective of his secret

Wisdom: احْفَظْ أَمْرَكَ وَلَا تُنْكِحْ خَاطِباً [خَاطِئاً] سِرَّكَ
enWisdom: Protect your affair and do not give away your secret in marriage to whoever proposes!

Wisdom: انْفَرِدْ بِسِرِّكَ وَلَا تُودِعْهُ حَازِماً فَيَزِلَّ وَلَا جَاهِلًا فَيَخُونَ
enWisdom: Keep your secret to yourself and neither entrust it to a judicious one who may err nor to an ignorant one who may betray [your trust]

Wisdom: سِرُّكَ سُرُورُكَ إِنْ كَتَمْتَهُ وَإِنْ أَذَعْتَهُ كَانَ ثُبُورَكَ
enWisdom: Your secret is a source of happiness for you if you conceal it but if you divulge it, it is your destruction

Wisdom: سِرُّكَ أَسِيرُكَ فَإِنْ أَفْشَيْتَهُ صِرْتَ أَسِيرَهُ
enWisdom: Your secret is your prisoner but if you divulge it, you become its prisoner

Wisdom: صَدْرُ الْعَاقِلِ صُنْدُوقُ سِرِّهِ
enWisdom: The chest of an intelligent person is the strongbox of his secret

Wisdom: كُنْ بِأَسْرَارِكَ بَخِيلًا وَلَا تُذِعْ سِرّاً أُودِعْتَهُ فَإِنَّ الْإِذَاعَةَ خِيَانَةٌ
enWisdom: Be stingy with your secrets and do not divulge the secret that has been entrusted to you, for indeed divulging [it] is betrayal

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا كَثُرَ خُزَّانُ الْأَسْرَارِ كَثُرَ ضِيَاعُهَا
enWisdom: Every time the keepers of secrets increase, [chances of] its divulgence becomes greater

Wisdom: كَاتِمُ السِّرِّ وَفِيٌّ أَمِينٌ
enWisdom: One who conceals the secret [that has been entrusted to him] is loyal and trustworthy

Wisdom: لَيْسَ كُلُّ عَوْرَةٍ تَظْهَرُ
enWisdom: Not every fault is manifested

Wisdom: مَنْ كَتَمَ سِرَّهُ كَانَتِ الْخِيَرَةُ بِيَدِهِ
enWisdom: One who conceals his secret has the choice [of doing as he wills with it] in his hand

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسَرَّ إِلَى غَيْرِ ثِقَةٍ ضَيَّعَ سِرَّهُ
enWisdom: One who entrusts his secret to an unreliable person has forfeited his secret

Wisdom: مِنْ تَوْفِيقِ الرَّجُلِ وَضْعُ سِرِّهِ عِنْدَ مَنْ يَسْتُرُهُ وَإِحْسَانُهُ عِنْدَ مَنْ يَنْشُرُهُ
enWisdom: From the success of a man is putting his secret in the hands of one who conceals it and [placing] his goodness with one who spreads it [and makes it known to others]

Wisdom: مِلَاكُ السِّرِّ سَتْرُهُ
enWisdom: The basis of a secret is its concealment

Wisdom: لَا تُودِعَنَّ سِرَّكَ مَنْ لَا أَمَانَةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: Do not entrust your secret to one who has no trustworthiness

Wisdom: لَا تُطْلِعْ زَوْجَكَ وَعَبْدَكَ عَلَى سِرِّكَ فَيَسْتَرِقَّاكَ
enWisdom: Do not inform your wife and your servant about your secret as they will [use it to] subjugate you

Wisdom: لَا تَهْتِكُوا أَسْتَارَكُمْ عِنْدَ مَنْ يَعْلَمُ أَسْرَارَكُمْ
enWisdom: Do not undertake acts of disobedience to Allah, the Glorified, and act with obedience to Him, as this will be a provision for you [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: لَا تُسِرَّ إِلَى الْجَاهِلِ شَيْئاً لَا يُطِيقُ كِتْمَانَهُ
enWisdom: Do not confide in the ignorant one with any secret that he is unable to conceal

Wisdom: وَلَا تُودِعْ سِتْرَكَ إِلَّا مُؤْمِناً وَفِيّاً
enWisdom: Do not mention your secret to anyone but the trustworthy and loyal

Wisdom: لَا حِرْزَ لِمَنْ لَا يَسَعُ سِرَّهُ صَدْرُهُ
enWisdom: One whose breast cannot accommodate his secret has no preservation (or prudence)
